codeLabChallenge_lightBackpackSayColor.q.translation: #7: LIGHT BACKPACK your favorite color, then SAY that color.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenFaceSay.questionSli.translation: #8: WHEN FACE IS SEEN, SAY "I see you."
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenFaceSaySayAndDrive..translation: #9: WHEN FACE IS SEEN, LIGHT BACKPACK a color, SAY something, and DRIVE FORWARD.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_lightBackpackMystery.qu.translation: #10: LIGHT BACKPACK a mystery color forever in a LOOP.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenCubeTappedMysteryBa.translation: #11: WHEN CUBE IS TAPPED, LIGHT BACKPACK a mystery color.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenCubeTappedMysteryAc.translation: #12: WHEN CUBE IS TAPPED, do MYSTERY ANIMATION.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenCubeSeenHappyAction.translation: Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenCubeSeenDriveToCube.translation: #14: SEE CUBE, then DRIVE TO CUBE.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_PushCube.questionSlide..translation: Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_MoveLiftUpAndDown.quest.translation: #16: MOVE LIFT up and down 3 TIMES.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_LiftCube.questionSlide..translation: Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_WorkoutWithCube.questio.translation: #18: Work out with Cube: DRIVE TO CUBE, LIFT it up and halfway down 3 TIMES, then SET IT DOWN.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_DriveFastSquare.questio.translation: Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_DriveSquareAdvanced.que.translation: #20: DRIVE FAST in a square, using only 4 code blocks.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenCubeTappedDriveSide.translation: #21: WHEN CUBE IS TAPPED, DRIVE one side of a square and TURN.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenSmileActHappy.quest.translation: #22: WHEN SMILE IS SEEN, ACT HAPPY.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenSmileDriveSide.ques.translation: #23: WHEN SMILE IS SEEN, DRIVE one side of a square and TURN.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenSmileActWinner.ques.translation: #24: SAY, "Smile!" WHEN SMILE IS SEEN, then ACT LIKE WINNER.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_peekaboo.questionSlide..translation: #25: Play Peekaboo. (WHEN FACE IS SEEN, ACT HAPPY. REPEAT FOREVER.)
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_stackCubes.questionSlid.translation: Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_stackCubesTipOver.quest.translation: #27: Stack 2 Cubes, then tip them over.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenFaceSeenTurnAround..translation: #28: WHEN FACE IS SEEN, TURN completely around.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenFaceSeenActSurprise.translation: #29: WHEN FACE IS SEEN, ACT SURPRISED, then TURN completely around.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenFaceFetchCube.quest.translation: #30: Fetch Cubes: Start with cubes a couple feet behind Cozmo. WHEN FACE IS SEEN, fetch a Cube and bring it back. REPEAT FOREVER.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_whenCubeSeenSetBehind.q.translation: #31: Put Cubes Back: WHEN CUBE IS SEEN, have Cozmo TURN and set the Cube a couple feet behind him and return. REPEAT FOREVER.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLabChallenge_intruder.questionSlide..translation: #32: WHEN FACE IS SEEN, ACT SURPRISED, then FOREVER: LIGHT BACKPACK red, SAY, "Intruder!" and blink BACKPACK off.
Try the challenge first, then tap NEXT to check your answer!

codeLab.tutorial.slide_letsYouProgramCoz.translation: Code Lab lets you program Cozmo.

codeLab.tutorial.slide_tapBlockToSeeFunc.translation: You can tap a code block to see what it does.

codeLab.tutorial.slide_dragBlocksToMakeP.translation: Drag code blocks together to make a program.

codeLab.tutorial.slide_greenBlockFirst.translation: Always place a green flag BLOCK first. That way, the green flag BUTTON starts your program!

codeLab.projects.confirmDeleteProject.co.translation: Are you sure you want to delete this project?

codeLab.projects.horizontalTab.horizonta.translation:
THE BEST PLACE
TO START CODING.
Simply snap together code blocks to create your first programs! Complete challenges to grow your skills.

codeLab.projects.verticalTab.verticalTab.translation:
TAKE YOUR CODING SKILLS
TO THE NEXT LEVEL.
With concepts like branching and loops, create complex programs with endless possibilties.

codeLab.projects.featuredTab.featuredTab.translation: Get inspired by the powerful programs you can create. Remix code blocks to jumpstart your own ideas!

codeLabFeaturedProject_HotPotato.project.translation: A Featured Project Name Two Lines
Multiple lines of text. This project is amazing! Let me tell you why.

codeLabFeaturedProject_MagicFortuneTelle.translation: Shake Cozmo and have your fortune told!

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.descri.translation: Drive forward X mm at Speed Y mm/s (doesn't use path planner, won't avoid anything)
Drive the left wheel at X mm/s and right wheel at Y mm/s
Stop any current movement on the selected motor(s)

Make Cozmo drive (using his path planner, so he will attempt to avoid obstacles) to a position Xmm to the left of Cozmo, and Ymm in front of Cozmo, facing an angle Z degrees offset from his current angle
(Same as above, but with absolute instead of relative coordinates). Make Cozmo drive (using his path planner, so he will attempt to avoid obstacles) to the position X,Y facing angle Z.
Turn X degrees at speed Y degrees/s
Make Cozmo drive to the first visible cube and dock with it (get in position to be able to pick up the cube, but without then raising the lift)
Make Cozmo drive to the specified cube and dock with it (get in position to be able to pick up the cube, but without then raising the lift)
Move the lift to X (0.0 = bottom, 1.0 = top) at speed Y degrees/s (note: it's an angular speed because the lift arm is technically rotating)
Set the lift to move at X degrees/s until either you stop it, or it reaches the top / bottom. (note: it's an angular speed because the lift arm is technically rotating)
Move the head to angle X degrees (it's clamped internally to between -25 and 45 degrees as they are the limits for looking down and up)
Set the backpack color (all 3 center LEDs) to the specified color (use black to turn off the lights).
Make Cozmo speak the specified text
Set the specified edge (1,2,3,4 or all 4 at once) of the specified cube to color X. (Use black to turn off the light)

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.title..translation: Play [spin, blink] anim on cube [1,2,3] with color (X)

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.descri.translation: Play an animation (lights spin or blink) on the specified cube with the specified color
Play the specified animation on Cozmo
A dropdown that contains each of the available animations, can be plugged in to the play animation block
Enable [Wheels, Head, Lift] animation track (all are enabled by default)
Disable [Wheels, Head, Lift] animation track (all are enabled by default)
Clear the screen on the current pending face image
Display the pending image on Cozmo's face (will stay there for up to 30 seconds, or when something else, e.g. another animation, interrupts it).
Set Draw Color for subsequent draw operations, default draws light, can be switched to erase
Set Text Scale, default is 1.0, larger values will draw larger text
Draw the specified text at the given position.
Draw a line between the 2 coordinates.
Draw a filled rectangle between the 2 coordinates
Draws an outlined (not filled) rectangle between the 2 coordinates
Draw an outlined (not filled) circle at the given position with the given radius.
Draws a filled circle at the given position with the given radius.
Self explanatory...
Activates (and runs the code underneath it) every-time Cozmo sees a face
Same as above, but only fires when the face has a happy expression
Same as above, but only fires when the face has a sad expression
Activates (and runs the code underneath it) every-time Cozmo sees a cube
Activates (and runs the code underneath it) every-time the given cube is tapped
Activates (and runs the code underneath it) every-time the given cube is moved
Executes the code under that hat block whenever something else broadcasts the corresponding message.

Sends a message, that can be handled by the "when I receive ..." block, note that the stack continues to execute, so the stacks under any receive hats will run in parallel with this - equivalent to starting a new thread in most programming languages.
Same as above, but waits for any events that handle that message to complete before continuing - is equivalent to a function call in most programming languages.
Wait X seconds
Repeat the enclosed code X times
Repeat the enclosed code forever (until program is stopped)
If the condition is true then do the blocks in A
If the condition is true then do the blocks in A, otherwise do the blocks in B
Wait until the condition evaluates to true
Repeat until the condition evaluated to true
Stop the given stack of blocks (or all = entire program)

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.title..translation: Enable wait for actions to complete

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.descri.translation: Enable automatically waiting for every action to complete before moving to the next block (this is the default behavior)

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.title..translation: Disable wait for actions to complete

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.descri.translation: Disable automatically waiting for every action to complete before moving to the next block

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.title..translation: Wait for [drive, head, lift, say, anim, all] actions to complete

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.descri.translation: Wait for any active actions that match the given type to complete

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.title..translation: Cancel [drive, head, lift, say, anim, all] actions

codeLabGlossary.block_definitions.descri.translation: Cancel any active actions that match the given type
The X, Y or Z component of Cozmo's world position
The angle, in degrees, that Cozmo is tilted forwards/backwards
The angle, in degrees, that Cozmo is tilted left/right
The angle that Cozmo is face (turning left/right)
The height of Cozmo's lift (between 0.0 and 1.0)
The angle of Cozmo's head in degrees (between -25 (looking down) and 45 (looking up))
Is the face currently visible
The name of the face (i.e. the name entered in Meet Cozmo) will be a zero-length string for unrecognized faces.
If visible, the X or Y component of the 2D position of the center of the face in Cozmo's camera view (0,0 to 320,240)
The X, Y or Z component of the face's world position
The current expression on the face, one of "happy", "upset" and "unknown"
Cube ID [1,2,3] for setting variables or passing into cube blocks
Is that cube currently visible (can Cozmo clearly see a marker)
If visible, the X or Y component of the 2D position of the center of the cube in Cozmo's camera view (0,0 to 320,240)
The X, Y or Z component of the cube's world position
The angle, in degrees, of the cube forward/backwards
The angle, in degrees, of the cube's tilt left/right
The angle, in degrees, that the cube is turned (if looking down from above)
The angle, in degrees, that the mobile device is tilted forward/backwards
The angle, in degrees, that the mobile device is tilted left/right
The angle, in degrees, that the mobile device is rotated left/right (if viewed from above)
Standard Scratch block, pretty self explanatory.
Returns the sum of X and Y
Returns X minus Y
Returns X multiplied by Y
Returns X divided by Y
Returns a random value between X and Y
True if X less than Y
True if X equal to Y
True if X greater than Y
True if both X and Y sub-conditions are true
True if either the X or Y sub-conditions are true
True if Y is false, false if Y is true
Concatenate 2 strings together
The Nth letter of the given string.
The length of the given string.
True if the second string is contained within the first string
The modulo division of X and Y (i.e. what's the remainder if you divide X by Y)
Round (X) to nearest integer value
Standard math operators from Scratch, should be familiar to anyone that's used a scientific calculator.
